questions.question: What is the primary problem faced by societies in terms of production?

answers.b: What goods and services to produce and in what quantities

questions.question: If a consumer buys 10 units of a product at $10 per unit and 12 units at $9 per unit, calculate the price elasticity of demand.
A firm operates on a production possibility curve. If it moves from point A to point B on the curve, what happens to the production of the two goods?

answers.b: Production of one good increases and the other decreases
answers.d: Production of one good increases and the other remains constant

questions.question: What is the concept of diminishing marginal utility?

answers.a: The additional utility from consuming a good decreases as consumption increases
answers.b: The additional utility from consuming a good increases as consumption increases
answers.c: The total utility from consuming a good remains constant
answers.d: The total utility from consuming a good decreases as consumption increases

questions.question: A consumer has a monthly income of $1000. He spends $500 on food and $300 on clothing. If the price of food increases by 20%, what happens to his consumption of food?

answers.c: His consumption of food remains constant

questions.question: What is the concept of consumer surplus?

answers.a: The additional benefit received by a consumer from buying a good at a price lower than their willingness to pay
answers.b: The additional cost incurred by a consumer from buying a good at a price higher than their willingness to pay
answers.c: The total benefit received by a consumer from buying a good
answers.d: The total cost incurred by a consumer from buying a good

questions.question: If the demand for a product is elastic, what happens to the quantity demanded when the price increases by 10%?

answers.a: The quantity demanded decreases by less than 10%
answers.b: The quantity demanded decreases by more than 10%

questions.question: What is the concept of opportunity cost?

answers.a: The value of the next best alternative that is given up when a choice is made
answers.b: The value of the chosen option
answers.c: The cost of producing a good
answers.d: The benefit received from consuming a good

questions.question: A firm produces two goods, X and Y. The production possibility curve shows that if the firm produces 10 units of X, it can produce 20 units of Y. If it produces 15 units of X, it can produce 15 units of Y. What is the opportunity cost of producing 5 more units of X?
What is the concept of deadweight loss?

answers.a: The loss of economic efficiency due to a tax or subsidy
answers.b: The gain of economic efficiency due to a tax or subsidy
answers.c: The loss of economic efficiency due to a change in consumer preferences
answers.d: The gain of economic efficiency due to a change in consumer preferences
